mnemonic: On a bright sunny DAY, a bizarre GOAT—yes, a goat—appears out of nowhere and goes on an absolute rampage, knocking over chairs, smashing windows, and tripping over everything. When you hear dégât (damage), think “day goat” causing outrageous destruction everywhere. This absurd image of a goat wrecking a place will remind you that dégât is all about damage. Enjoy the madness!
kazıman, faik ve presk diye 3 arkadaş var her hikayeyi başlayıp tam anlatıcakken yarım bırakıyolar (almost).
dondurmacı para almak için elini uzatıyo, sonra başarıyo

Imagine seeing a massive, ancient building that's falling apart. To save it, Batman arrives but he’s Turkish! Instead of using gadgets, he dramatically shouts 'Batı ise batı, doğu ise doğu!' (meaning 'West is west, east is east!' in Turkish). Confused, people around him ask, 'But Batman, why this?' (sounds like 'bâtisse'). Batman then explains he needs to align the building exactly east-west to restore its ancient power.This hilarious scenario of Turkish Batman obsessing over directions ('batı ise') to fix an old building will remind you of 'bâtisse.

Imagine a superhero called Réglo who carries an enormous, flashy ruler. This ruler isn’t just any tool—it’s his symbol of fairness and order. Wherever he goes, he measures everything to make sure it’s “by the book.” The word 'réglo' sounds a bit like 'ruler,' so whenever you hear it, picture this strict-but-cool superhero ensuring that all things are regular, straight, and honest.

Imagine a superhero called Réglo who carries an enormous, flashy ruler. This ruler isn’t just any tool—it’s his symbol of fairness and order. Wherever he goes, he measures everything to make sure it’s “by the book.” The word 'réglo' sounds a bit like 'ruler,' so whenever you hear it, picture this strict-but-cool superhero ensuring that all things are regular, straight, and honest.

Imagine Pikachu secretly drinking alcohol from a giant bottle labeled 'Cola' (Pika-Cola). Pikachu hiccups, drunk, and giggles 'Pika-cola!' ('picole'). The image of a tipsy Pikachu drinking 'cola' secretly will remind you that 'picole' is slang for alcohol.
Two friends: Quack ile Soğan, like to annoy people 'regardless' what everyone thinks

Imagine you're trying to stuff all your belongings ('tout') into a tiny suitcase ('case'). No matter how impossible it seems, you're determined and say 'En TU Case!' as you hilariously try to stuff even a ballerina wearing a tutu inside the suitcase. You shrug, saying 'I'll take everything, in any case!'

Imagine someone shouting 'SUS LAN, SENTOR!' at a centaur who's wearing pants only below the belt, making the upper half awkwardly exposed. This inappropriate dressing reminds you that 'sous la ceinture' means inappropriate or 'below the belt.'
Imagine you're nervously preparing to face a giant monster. Suddenly, your Turkish coach yells at you 'FERİ, FACE'ini göster!' to remind you to bravely face the monster.

word: Avoir le cœur sur la main

image: images\avoir le cœur sur la main.PNG

mnemonic: Imagine someone proudly showing off a phone made entirely of meat ('et') and confidently saying 'Et Alo?' (meat phone), but people stare unimpressed, saying 'So what?' This absurd scene helps you remember 'et alors?' means 'so what?'
Imagine someone so happy they're literally floating with angels.
Birisinin arkadaşıyla dalga geçerek sinir etmek için evinin önüne market yapmasını düşün.

Imagine someone fed up, dramatically saying 'J'en ai ma CLOCK!' as they angrily smash an oversized alarm clock that's been ringing non-stop. This helps you remember 'j'en ai ma claque' means 'I'm fed up.'

Imagine someone trying to butter up their boss ('yağ çekmek') by literally blowing smoke ('fume') into the boss's ears, absurdly complimenting them at the same time. This bizarre flattery helps you remember 's'enfumer' means 'yağ çekmek.'
Imagine someone named 'Selin' ('Selin gider') dramatically walking away ('uzaklaşmak') from an absurd scene, saying 'Selin gider!'
Imagine someone happily eating 'Profiterol' dessert, thoroughly enjoying ('tadını çıkarmak') each bite, saying 'Profiterol ile profiter!'
Imagine someone literally holding a giant tooth ('dent') and angrily throwing it towards a woman, expressing they have a grudge ('garez') against her.
Imagine people laughing uncontrollably while someone is marrying ('marrer'). The absurd wedding causes everyone 'to laugh.'
Imagine an ant named 'Mar-Ant,' who tells absurdly funny jokes, making everyone laugh uncontrollably.
Imagine someone looking through binoculars at a building and deliberately focusing only on the brightly painted, happy corner labeled 'BON,' completely ignoring the dark, gloomy sides.

mnemonic: On a bright sunny DAY, a bizarre GOAT—yes, a goat—appears out of nowhere and goes on an absolute rampage, knocking over chairs, smashing windows, and tripping over everything. When you hear dégât (damage), think “day goat” causing outrageous destruction everywhere. This absurd image of a goat wrecking a place will remind you that dégât is all about damage. Enjoy the madness!
kazıman, faik ve presk diye 3 arkadaş var her hikayeyi başlayıp tam anlatıcakken yarım bırakıyolar (almost).
dondurmacı para almak için elini uzatıyo, sonra başarıyo

Imagine seeing a massive, ancient building that's falling apart. To save it, Batman arrives but he’s Turkish! Instead of using gadgets, he dramatically shouts 'Batı ise batı, doğu ise doğu!' (meaning 'West is west, east is east!' in Turkish). Confused, people around him ask, 'But Batman, why this?' (sounds like 'bâtisse'). Batman then explains he needs to align the building exactly east-west to restore its ancient power.This hilarious scenario of Turkish Batman obsessing over directions ('batı ise') to fix an old building will remind you of 'bâtisse.

Imagine a superhero called Réglo who carries an enormous, flashy ruler. This ruler isn’t just any tool—it’s his symbol of fairness and order. Wherever he goes, he measures everything to make sure it’s “by the book.” The word 'réglo' sounds a bit like 'ruler,' so whenever you hear it, picture this strict-but-cool superhero ensuring that all things are regular, straight, and honest.

Imagine a superhero called Réglo who carries an enormous, flashy ruler. This ruler isn’t just any tool—it’s his symbol of fairness and order. Wherever he goes, he measures everything to make sure it’s “by the book.” The word 'réglo' sounds a bit like 'ruler,' so whenever you hear it, picture this strict-but-cool superhero ensuring that all things are regular, straight, and honest.

Imagine Pikachu secretly drinking alcohol from a giant bottle labeled 'Cola' (Pika-Cola). Pikachu hiccups, drunk, and giggles 'Pika-cola!' ('picole'). The image of a tipsy Pikachu drinking 'cola' secretly will remind you that 'picole' is slang for alcohol.
Two friends: Quack ile Soğan, like to annoy people 'regardless' what everyone thinks

Imagine you're trying to stuff all your belongings ('tout') into a tiny suitcase ('case'). No matter how impossible it seems, you're determined and say 'En TU Case!' as you hilariously try to stuff even a ballerina wearing a tutu inside the suitcase. You shrug, saying 'I'll take everything, in any case!'

Imagine someone shouting 'SUS LAN, SENTOR!' at a centaur who's wearing pants only below the belt, making the upper half awkwardly exposed. This inappropriate dressing reminds you that 'sous la ceinture' means inappropriate or 'below the belt.'
Imagine you're nervously preparing to face a giant monster. Suddenly, your Turkish coach yells at you 'FERİ, FACE'ini göster!' to remind you to bravely face the monster.
o kadar bonkör ki kalbini veriyo
translation: Avoir le cœur sur la main
image: images\avoir le cœur sur la main.PNG

mnemonic: Imagine someone proudly showing off a phone made entirely of meat ('et') and confidently saying 'Et Alo?' (meat phone), but people stare unimpressed, saying 'So what?' This absurd scene helps you remember 'et alors?' means 'so what?'
Imagine someone so happy they're literally floating with angels.
Birisinin arkadaşıyla dalga geçerek sinir etmek için evinin önüne market yapmasını düşün.

Imagine someone fed up, dramatically saying 'J'en ai ma CLOCK!' as they angrily smash an oversized alarm clock that's been ringing non-stop. This helps you remember 'j'en ai ma claque' means 'I'm fed up.'

Imagine someone trying to butter up their boss ('yağ çekmek') by literally blowing smoke ('fume') into the boss's ears, absurdly complimenting them at the same time. This bizarre flattery helps you remember 's'enfumer' means 'yağ çekmek.'
Imagine someone named 'Selin' ('Selin gider') dramatically walking away ('uzaklaşmak') from an absurd scene, saying 'Selin gider!'
Imagine someone happily eating 'Profiterol' dessert, thoroughly enjoying ('tadını çıkarmak') each bite, saying 'Profiterol ile profiter!'
Imagine someone literally holding a giant tooth ('dent') and angrily throwing it towards a woman, expressing they have a grudge ('garez') against her.
Imagine people laughing uncontrollably while someone is marrying ('marrer'). The absurd wedding causes everyone 'to laugh.'
Imagine an ant named 'Mar-Ant,' who tells absurdly funny jokes, making everyone laugh uncontrollably.
Imagine someone looking through binoculars at a building and deliberately focusing only on the brightly painted, happy corner labeled 'BON,' completely ignoring the dark, gloomy sides.
